prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in high school would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in high school would. The probability of snow for each of the next three days is $\frac{3}{4}$. What is the probability that it will not snow at all during the next three days? Express your answer as a common fraction.
solution: The probability of it snowing on any one day is $\frac{3}{4}$ so the probability of it not snowing on any one day is $\frac{1}{4}$. So, the probability it not snowing on all three days is $\left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^3 = \boxed{\frac{1}{64}}$.
gpt_response:
To find the probability that it will not snow at all during the next three days, we need to consider the probability that it will not snow on each individual day. 

Since the probability of snow for each day is $\frac{3}{4}$, the probability of no snow on each day is $1-\frac{3}{4}=\frac{1}{4}$.

The probability that it will not snow at all during the next three days is the product of the probabilities that it will not snow on each individual day: $\left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^3=\frac{1}{64}$.

Therefore, the probability that it will not snow at all during the next three days is $\boxed{\frac{1}{64}}$.
